text: Presidential elections were held in Sri Lanka on 20 July 2022. President Gotabaya Rajapaksa left the country on 13 July 2022 instead of resigning as he promised. Ranil Wickremesinghe won the election and will serve a term of 2 years. == Candidates == === Declared === ===United National Party (UNP)=== ====Declared==== *Ranil Wickremesinghe, incumbent Acting President of Sri Lanka, incumbent Prime Minister of Sri Lanka ===Sri Lanka People's Front (SLPP)=== ====Declared==== *Dullas Alahapperuma,Former former Minister of Mass Media (2021-2022), and Member of Parliament for Matara District (2015-Present) ===National People's Power (NPP)=== ====Declared==== * Anura Kumara Dissanayaka , Former Chief Opposition Whip (2015-2018), Member of Parliament from Colombo Electoral District (2015–present) === Withdrawn === ==== Sri Lanka People's Front (SLPP) ==== * Gotabaya Rajapaksa, former President of Sri Lanka (20192022) ==== United People's Power (SJB) ==== *Sajith Premadasa, incumbent Leader of the Opposition (2020–present), Member of Parliament from Colombo Electoral District (2020–present) initially declared to run for presidency. On 19 July, the day of selecting nominees, he withdrew his candidacy and announced that he and his party decided to support Dullas Alahapperuma. === Declined === ==== Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) ==== *Maithripala Sirisena, former President of Sri Lanka (2015–2019) == Results == == References == Category:2022 elections in Asia Category:July 2022 events Category:Presidential elections Category:2020s in Sri Lanka
title: 2022 Sri Lankan presidential election
